summary: Coast Guard regulations require tankers and other large vessels to have plans for responding to incidents that caused or could cause an oil spill. Plans must identify response resources, such as the equipment needed for spill cleanup, salvage, and firefighting. However, we found that the Coast Guard has only verified the accuracy of the salvage and firefighting information in 71 of over 3,000 of these...
title: Coast Guard: Improved Analysis of Vessel Response Plan Use Could Help Mitigate Marine Pollution Risk
